test_questions.question: Which of the following is correct for a gated D-type flip-flop?

test_questions.optd: The output toggles if one of the inputs is held HIGH.

test_questions.question: What is the significance of the J and K terminals on the J-K flip-flop?
test_questions.opta: There is no known significance in their designations.
test_questions.optb: The J represents "jump," which is how the Q output reacts whenever the clock goes HIGH and the J input is also HIGH.
test_questions.optc: The letters represent the initials of Johnson and King, the co-inventors of the J-K flip-flop.
test_questions.optd: All of the other letters of the alphabet are already in use.
